title: Town turns out to say goodbye to 'beautiful' woman, 20, found 'murdered' in woods
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A young woman found dead in a wood has had a town turn out for her funeral service.

Crowds lined the streets as "beautiful" Keeley Bunker's funeral procession passed through Tamworth, Staffordshire.

The 20 year old had been discovered lying in a stream, hours after watching rapper Aitch perform at the O2 in Birmingham.

Missing person appeals were issued on social media after Keeley failed to return home from the concert.

(Image: SWNS)

(Image: SWNS)

A white horse drawn carriage with pink bows and feathers carried Keeley on her final journey as her close friends and family followed.

Pink ribbons lined every lamppost and sign on the route and were attached to every car in the procession, Birmingham Live reports.

Hundreds of people gathered in the market square outside St Editha’s church in the town to pay their respects.

A statement from Keeley’s family said: “Keeley was a bright, caring, beautiful girl who touched the hearts of the people closest to her.”

(Image: SWNS)

(Image: SWNS)

The service took place just over a month after her body was found.

*Wesley Streete, 19, from Tamworth, has been charged with murder.

A trial date has been set for March 16, 2020.
description: Crowds lined the streets as "beautiful" Keeley Bunker's funeral procession passed through Tamworth, Staffordshire
